question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Let $a,$ $b,$ $c,$ $p,$ $q,$ and $r$ be real numbers such that
\[ egin{vmatrix} p & b & c \ a & q & c \ a & b & r \end{vmatrix} = 0.\]Assuming that $a 
eq p,$ $b 
eq q,$ and $c 
eq r,$ find the value of $ rac{p}{p - a} +  rac{q}{q - b} +  rac{r}{r - c}.$
inference:
Expanding the determinant, we get
\[pqr - pcq - pbr + acr + abq - abr = 0.\]We can rewrite this as
\[pqr - p(cq + br) + a(cr + bq) - abr = 0.\]Since $a \neq p,$ we can divide both sides by $p - a,$ to get
\[\frac{pqr - p(cq + br) + a(cr + bq) - abr}{p - a} = 0.\]This simplifies to
\[\frac{p(qr - cq - br) + a(cr + bq - br)}{p - a} = 0.\]Since $b \neq q,$ we can divide both sides by $q - b,$ to get
\[\frac{p(qr - cq - br) + a(cr + bq - br)}{(p - a)(q - b)} = 0.\]This simplifies to
\[\frac{p(qr - cq - br) + a(cr + bq - br)}{(p - a)(q - b)} = 0.\]Since $c \neq r,$ we can divide both sides by $r - c,$ to get
\[\frac{p(qr - cq - br) + a(cr + bq - br)}{(p - a)(q - b)(r - c)} = 0.\]This simplifies to
\[\frac{p(qr - cq - br) + a(cr + bq - br)}{(p - a)(q - b)(r - c)} = 0.\]Since the denominator is nonzero, the numerator must be zero.  Thus,
\[p(qr - cq - br) + a(cr + bq - br) = 0.\]Then
\[p(qr - cq - br) = -a(cr + bq - br).\]Dividing both sides by $(p - a)(qr - cq - br),$ we get
\[\frac{p}{p - a} = -\frac{a(cr + bq - br)}{(p - a)(qr - cq - br)}.\]Similarly,
\[\frac{q}{q - b} = -\frac{b(ar + cp - cr)}{(q - b)(pr - ap - cr)},\]and
\[\frac{r}{r - c} = -\frac{c(ap + bq - aq)}{(r - c)(pq - bp - aq)}.\]Adding these equations, we get
\begin{align*}
\frac{p}{p - a} + \frac{q}{q - b} + \frac{r}{r - c} &= -\frac{a(cr + bq - br)}{(p - a)(qr - cq - br)} - \frac{b(ar + cp - cr)}{(q - b)(pr - ap - cr)} - \frac{c(ap + bq - aq)}{(r - c)(pq - bp - aq)} \\
&= \frac{-a(cr + bq - br)(q - b)(r - c) - b(ar + cp - cr)(p - a)(r - c) - c(ap + bq - aq)(p - a)(q - b)}{(p - a)(q - b)(r - c)(pr - ap - cr)(pq - bp - aq)} \\
&= \boxed{0}.
\end{align*}Final Answer: $\boxed{0}$. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth:
Expanding the determinant, we get
\begin{align*}
\begin{vmatrix} p & b & c \\ a & q & c \\ a & b & r \end{vmatrix} &= p \begin{vmatrix} q & c \\ b & r \end{vmatrix} - b \begin{vmatrix} a & c \\ a & r \end{vmatrix} + c \begin{vmatrix} a & q \\ a & b \end{vmatrix} \\
&= p(qr - bc) - b(ar - ac) + c(ab - aq) \\
&= pqr - bpc - abr + abc + abc - acq \\
&= 2abc - abr - acq - bcp + pqr.
\end{align*}Let $x = p - a,$ $y = q - b,$ and $z = r - c.$  Then $p = a + x,$ $q = b + y,$ and $r = c + z.$  Substituting, we get
\[2abc - ab(c + z) - ac(b + y) - bc(a + x) + (a + x)(b + y)(c + z) = 0.\]This simplifies to $ayz + bxz + cxy + xyz = 0.$

Then
\begin{align*}
\frac{p}{p - a} + \frac{q}{q - b} + \frac{r}{r - c} &= \frac{a + x}{x} + \frac{b + y}{y} + \frac{c + z}{z} \\
&= \frac{a}{x} + 1 + \frac{b}{y} + 1 + \frac{c}{z} + 1 \\
&= \frac{a}{x} + \frac{b}{y} + \frac{c}{z} + 3 \\
&= \frac{ayz + bxz + cxy}{xyz} +  3 \\
&= \frac{-xyz}{xyz} + 3 = \boxed{2}.
\end{align*}

Expanding the determinant, we get
\[pqr - pcq - pbr + acr + abq - abr = 0.\]We can rewrite this as
\[pqr - p(cq + br) + a(cr + bq) - abr = 0.\]Since $a \neq p,$ we can divide both sides by $p - a,$ to get
\[\frac{pqr - p(cq + br) + a(cr + bq) - abr}{p - a} = 0.\]This simplifies to
\[\frac{p(qr - cq - br) + a(cr + bq - br)}{p - a} = 0.\]Since $b \neq q,$ we can divide both sides by $q - b,$ to get
\[\frac{p(qr - cq - br) + a(cr + bq - br)}{(p - a)(q - b)} = 0.\]This simplifies to
\[\frac{p(qr - cq - br) + a(cr + bq - br)}{(p - a)(q - b)} = 0.\]Since $c \neq r,$ we can divide both sides by $r - c,$ to get
\[\frac{p(qr - cq - br) + a(cr + bq - br)}{(p - a)(q - b)(r - c)} = 0.\]This simplifies to
\[\frac{p(qr - cq - br) + a(cr + bq - br)}{(p - a)(q - b)(r - c)} = 0.\]Since the denominator is nonzero, the numerator must be zero.  Thus,
\[p(qr - cq - br) + a(cr + bq - br) = 0.\]Then
\[p(qr - cq - br) = -a(cr + bq - br).\]Dividing both sides by $(p - a)(qr - cq - br),$ we get
\[\frac{p}{p - a} = -\frac{a(cr + bq - br)}{(p - a)(qr - cq - br)}.\]Similarly,
\[\frac{q}{q - b} = -\frac{b(ar + cp - cr)}{(q - b)(pr - ap - cr)},\]and
\[\frac{r}{r - c} = -\frac{c(ap + bq - aq)}{(r - c)(pq - bp - aq)}.\]Adding these equations, we get
\begin{align*}
\frac{p}{p - a} + \frac{q}{q - b} + \frac{r}{r - c} &= -\frac{a(cr + bq - br)}{(p - a)(qr - cq - br)} - \frac{b(ar + cp - cr)}{(q - b)(pr - ap - cr)} - \frac{c(ap + bq - aq)}{(r - c)(pq - bp - aq)} \\
&= \frac{-a(cr + bq - br)(q - b)(r - c) - b(ar + cp - cr)(p - a)(r - c) - c(ap + bq - aq)(p - a)(q - b)}{(p - a)(q - b)(r - c)(pr - ap - cr)(pq - bp - aq)} \\
&= \boxed{0}.
\end{align*}Final Answer: $\boxed{0}$. I hope it is correct.

ground_truth:
Expanding the determinant, we get
\begin{align*}
\begin{vmatrix} p & b & c \\ a & q & c \\ a & b & r \end{vmatrix} &= p \begin{vmatrix} q & c \\ b & r \end{vmatrix} - b \begin{vmatrix} a & c \\ a & r \end{vmatrix} + c \begin{vmatrix} a & q \\ a & b \end{vmatrix} \\
&= p(qr - bc) - b(ar - ac) + c(ab - aq) \\
&= pqr - bpc - abr + abc + abc - acq \\
&= 2abc - abr - acq - bcp + pqr.
\end{align*}Let $x = p - a,$ $y = q - b,$ and $z = r - c.$  Then $p = a + x,$ $q = b + y,$ and $r = c + z.$  Substituting, we get
\[2abc - ab(c + z) - ac(b + y) - bc(a + x) + (a + x)(b + y)(c + z) = 0.\]This simplifies to $ayz + bxz + cxy + xyz = 0.$

Then
\begin{align*}
\frac{p}{p - a} + \frac{q}{q - b} + \frac{r}{r - c} &= \frac{a + x}{x} + \frac{b + y}{y} + \frac{c + z}{z} \\
&= \frac{a}{x} + 1 + \frac{b}{y} + 1 + \frac{c}{z} + 1 \\
&= \frac{a}{x} + \frac{b}{y} + \frac{c}{z} + 3 \\
&= \frac{ayz + bxz + cxy}{xyz} +  3 \\
&= \frac{-xyz}{xyz} + 3 = \boxed{2}.
\end{align*}
